Text: Pipeline Cutoffs Cc Just an update to keep everyone current on the progress of this initiative We Matt from Unify Liz Dave and myself met today and attempted to find ways to directly relate the Passport information from El Paso to the corresponding prices etc in Unify Unfortunately we discovered that there is no direct foolproof way to accomplish this However we have come up with a couple of things to try Liz is going to contact El Paso directly and see if there is any other information they can provide in the Passport file that better uniquely identifies each deal cut Hopefully this will be something that makes relating the data to Unify much easier Matt is going to take a look at the format content of the scheduled quantity file that comes in currently through the EDI Hub Its possible that this file contains cut information itself which would possibly alleviate the need to use the Passport file altogether I believe that succinctly recaps the results of our meeting today If I have misrepresented anything please let me know Also feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns Thanks Chris

RE Cc NW data has been reloaded Let me know if there is anything else I can do Thanks Chris Original Message From Holst Keith Sent Friday October PM To Hyde Chris Subject Read RE Your message To Holst Keith Subject RE Sent PM was read on PM
RE NWPL pointsall loaded chris Original Message From Reitmeyer Jay Sent Friday October PM To Hyde Chris Subject NWPL points File NWPL point namesxls

Alas Cc As they say All good things must come to an end Unfortunately this is hardly ever more true than in the IT consulting realm I have been informed that as of this Friday my assignment here at Enron comes to an end Obviously Enrons current economic uncertainty predicated the need to alleviate any and all excess baggage read consultantcontractor costs I truly have enjoyed my time here in the Gas Fundamentals group I have definitely learned a great deal from everyone and hopefully have helped others to do the same I leave my contact information below in hopes that if there is anything I can do for you in the future you will not hesitate to get in touch with me especially to let me know what time to be at Front Porch All kidding aside this has been a great overall experience for me From now until Friday I will be involved in handing off all projectsinitiatives that I have been a part of or directly responsible for If there is anything needed of me between now and then feel free to give me a call x or stop by ECS prior to Friday Thanks for everything and I wish everyone the best of luck in their future endeavors Sincerely Chris Hyde Contact Info Office Cell Home email

Current Web Site Issues Cc Just as a headsup Currently the sites for Kern Questar and Overthrust are having issues These will be watched for the remainder of the day but it is possible that these sites will be problematic over the weekend Thanks Chris
IHS Reload Cc IHS data has been reloaded with the May CDthere were approx or so records added Thanks Chris
PGE Dataeverything reloadedtake a look at the data and let me know chris

FW QuestarOriginal Message From Hyde Chris Sent Thursday April PM To Smith Matt Piazze Tara Reitmeyer Jay Gaskill Chris Cc Tonks Colin Subject Questar As per our discussion I have done the following to fix the issues with Questar data dumped data from present for all cycles fixed the transform component to pull the proper column for utilized capacity and also to assign the correct effective date for each value retransformed and reloaded ALL cycle data from the htm files we have Now in loading the or so days back into the DB approx PRIMARY KEY violations were loggedthis means that they are duplicating point data within the same day same cycle etc If this data could be examined more closely in the reports that are subsequently generated we can make sure that things are truly copacetic from our side a surface scan of the htm files shows that they are indeed duplicating points usually with different namesthe utilized capacity associated with these points is the same though so this doesnt appear to be a big issue except for the fact that we will continue to have primary key violations being logged As always any questions just ask Thanks Chris

PGE Storage Balances Cc I have the changes in place in order to start capturing the storage balances for the identified PGE points PGE Storage and Wild Goose Storage The next scrape time for PGE is today so we can evaluate the first run of these values shortly after that Through the end of the week and even beyond this data should be monitored closely to make sure the calculations are correct Any questionsconcerns let me know Chris Pipeline ID DRNs PGEINV WILDGOOSEINV Data starts with effective date cycle this value obtained from the old PGE Operational Report needed to seed the rolling calculations
SoCal Data Changesall setplease double check to make sure the values are now correct thanks chris

IHS Reload Cc In order to keep the Pipeline Flow database as current as possible and to help out Catalina and Sachin with the migration of their reports I have reloaded the IHSPIPELINEMETER table in the FDYPIPELINEDEV database It now contains data from the April CD as given to me by Tara Let me know of any questionsconcerns Thanks Chris

KNE web site problems Cc Just as a heads up The web site that serves data for Kinder Morgan Transcolorado NGPL etc is having issues as I write this The following message comes up when trying to receive point data An error occurred while executing the page Please use the Back button on your browser to try again or try again at a later time If the problem persists please contact ApplicationName Support The error message is INTERSOLVODBC SQL Server driverSQL Serverctresults user api layer internal Client Library error Read from the server has timed out Basically this means their server currently has issues I just wanted to send this out as a heads up that we could potentially miss some cycle information for the morning reports Hopefully the site will stabilize before then Thanks Chris

QuestarOverthrust and Other Harvesting Issues This Weekend Cc Questar appears to not have updated their data since files we scraped over this weekend contain no data after that date Overthrust appears to have had problems with their site this weekend All cycles failed this weekend Transcolorado Deliveries Kinder Morgan Segments Cycle also had some issues this weekendthose jobs have been reset as well I have reset all of the above jobs but we may need to look into recovering data for the lost days Chris

QuestarOverthrust etc Issues this weekend Cc First of all dont ask me why Im still up at this hour cause even I dont knowbut since I am I guess I can be accomplishing something constructive so here goes Questar appears to have returned to normal Their data is now up to date and I have reenabled all of the jobs Hopefully things are back to normal for them Overthrust appears to be back up albeit at a slightly different URL they moved from cgibinrcgiexepiprodit to cgibinrwcgiexepiprodit A slight change but enough to affect us if ONE character changes in the URL it affects us So I have modified the capture jobs for Overthrust to use this new URLhopefully they also have stabilized Now there is still data that has been missed for these pipeswe should look into possible recovery at the earliest convenience Anyway just wanted to give everyone a headsup of the happenings Thanks Chris

RE New DRN Cc Chris Original Message From Smith Matt Sent Tue PM To Hyde Chris Cc Piazze Tara Subject New DRN Chris Please add the following new point to the database for PGT and make sure we begin to scape it along with the others DRN Name Klamath Cogeneration PacifiCorp This is a scraped point currently being posted This DRN is the same as the IHS DRN for this point Thanks Mat

RE New DRNit has been coming up as a foreign key violationlook at yesterday on the foreign key page to and its there chris Original Message From Piazze Tara Sent Tue PM To Hyde Chris Smith Matt Cc Subject RE New DRN chris why did this point not come up as a foreign key violation apparently its been posted on the web since May th thanks tara Original Message From Hyde Chris Sent Tuesday June PM To Smith Matt Cc Piazze Tara Subject RE New DRN done Chris Original Message From Smith Matt Sent Tue PM To Hyde Chris Cc Piazze Tara Subject New DRN Chris Please add the following new point to the database for PGT and make sure we begin to scape it along with the others DRN Name Klamath Cogeneration PacifiCorp This is a scraped point currently being posted This DRN is the same as the IHS DRN for this point Thanks Mat

Harvesting Issues Cc It appears that the wrong service was stopped last nighta request to stoprestart the realtime weather service also seems to have resulted in the stopping of the Jaguar harvester This caused no scrape jobs to run last night This morning the service has been restarted and data has been recovered This should be examined closely as there is the possibility that information is the same for cycles and of certain pipes this may or may not be an issueif it is please advise us on what should be done Thanks Chris

A light at the end of the tunnel Cc The completion of the identified scrapable East Desk pipes is in site pun intended there are only a few outstanding issues remaining The pipes in question are National Fuel and Gas This site does a bit of checking to verify how you get to thembasically it appears they make sure you come to them from a source they trust Attempts to work around this have so far failed so Tara has placed a call to them directly to try and get a resolution to this problem TCO We have discovered a workaround for the strange Javascript issues of this site but now have discovered that this alternative way to access the data does not necessarily report as much as the original Sabina is looking into this contacting the pipeline themself for help CGT This is a sister pipe of TCO and thus has the same Javascript issues We have also found a way around this but Eddie is not completely certain the data is the same Im going to work with him this afternoon to see if together we can figure it out It may be that CGT has the same problem as TCO not as much data reported in the alternate method And thats it TETCO has been finished today and Iroquois has been set up as a manual entry pipe So from what we can see finishing the above pipes finishes off the everything identified thus far for the East Desk Now my only question is whos bringing the keg in on Friday As always any questions just ask Thanks Chris

RE west pl daily morning report Cc id is Northwest Manual Entry Original Message From Zhang Eddie Sent Wednesday June PM To Hyde Chris Subject FW west pl daily morning report Original Message From Smith Matt Sent Tuesday June PM To Zhang Eddie Subject RE west pl daily morning report Eddie Well need a new pipeline for Northwest manual entry The point should have DRN JPINV but no corresponding IHS DRN Please populate the database with a value of with flow type S for We will manually enter this point until we can automate it Mat

Manual Entry Cc I have the Manual Entry process ready for testing again testing as in testing by the analysts I would prefer to have it used by the analysts at least for a few days to iron out any more potential bugs before releasing it to users on the floor If the consensus is to have people on the floor be the testers that is fine as well as long as they know that the following URL points to a development server Without further ado the link to the Manual Entry Page adminmanualentry As stated in the above URL this is located on the DEVELOPMENT web server Users should honestly never be directed to this URL unless authorized by one of the site developers since anything on it is subject to be currently in development read potentially broken Anyway here are some things that have been added to the Manual Entry piece in this release Previous data now reflects information in the DB for the latest effective date for the selected cycle not just Yesterday as before There is now an option to enter data for a special cycle this is to be used on occasions where no data was scraped for whatever reason but there is some available that can be manually entered Selecting this option causes ALL points for a given pipeline to be displayed both normally scraped points AND manually entered points A cycle of is applied to this data and it should only show up on reports until valid scrape data becomes available since the report engine is designed to pull the latest cycle available You can now add extra line items to be stored in the DBthis is to be used when you must enter data for more than one flow type for a given point ie the point is reported as both a Receipt and a Delivery This should normally only have to be done the first time data is entered for that pipe since the Previous data will handle pulling in and displaying the next time every flow type stored for every point on the pipe NOTE It is set to only allow extra point to be addedthis was done to simplify the handling of this feature Im open to discussion if you feel there is a need to enter more than one extra point I see it as a ReceiptDelivery issuewill a point ever be more than that ReceiptDeliveryStorage or something I have also fixed the Exceptions Occurred bug that cropped up recentlythis was caused by moving the manually entered points to their own unique pipeline ids The Jaguar system did not get updated to account for that but it is updated now Aside from the above minor tweaks here and there have also been made I am going to enlist the aid of Junellen to beautify the layout but provided no more bugs appear during testing this should be good to go into production by the beginning of next week Any questions feel free to ask or reply Thanks Chris

Questar Cc As per our discussion I have done the following to fix the issues with Questar data dumped data from present for all cycles fixed the transform component to pull the proper column for utilized capacity and also to assign the correct effective date for each value retransformed and reloaded ALL cycle data from the htm files we have Now in loading the or so days back into the DB approx PRIMARY KEY violations were loggedthis means that they are duplicating point data within the same day same cycle etc If this data could be examined more closely in the reports that are subsequently generated we can make sure that things are truly copacetic from our side a surface scan of the htm files shows that they are indeed duplicating points usually with different namesthe utilized capacity associated with these points is the same though so this doesnt appear to be a big issue except for the fact that we will continue to have primary key violations being logged As always any questions just ask Thanks Chris

West Desk Power Loads Cc Jason et al We are approaching somewhat of a slowdown in active harvesting development and therefore it is a prime opportunity to begin hashing out what is required to gather the West Power load data you have previously mentioned We should get together personally to better organize this initiative but some things to prime the pump are What are the requisite sites involved URLs etc What is the frequency of jobs how often do we scrape the data once a day x number of time a day etc What is the nature of the data we are scraping this will help us to determine if we already have a database schema that this will fit into or if we need to extenddevelop one These are just some topics to get us startedyou may have already answered someall of these previously but I feel they deserve mentioning again if for no other reason than to make sure we are all on the same page moving forward Please reply with your availability over the next few days as well as anyone else you feel should be involved in this effort and I will have Amanda schedule a meetingroom for us to get this started Thanks Chris

RE pgedonelet me know if there are any more problems chris Original Message From Smith Matt Sent Friday April PM To Hyde Chris Cc Piazze Tara Subject pge Chris Remember way back whenwe threw out a bunch of PGE data that we were going to reload from the saved html files Anyway it looks like were missing data from through As we discussed we should have the html files so can we run those through the transform and get them into the database Let me know if there are any issues Mat

Alas Cc As they say All good things must come to an end Unfortunately this is hardly ever more true than in the IT consulting realm I have been informed that as of this Friday my assignment here at Enron comes to an end Obviously Enrons current economic uncertainty predicated the need to alleviate any and all excess baggage read consultantcontractor costs I truly have enjoyed my time here in the Gas Fundamentals group I have definitely learned a great deal from everyone and hopefully have helped others to do the same I leave my contact information below in hopes that if there is anything I can do for you in the future you will not hesitate to get in touch with me especially to let me know what time to be at Front Porch All kidding aside this has been a great overall experience for me From now until Friday I will be involved in handing off all projectsinitiatives that I have been a part of or directly responsible for If there is anything needed of me between now and then feel free to give me a call x or stop by ECS prior to Friday Thanks for everything and I wish everyone the best of luck in their future endeavors Sincerely Chris Hyde Contact Info Office Cell Home email

RE El Paso Manual Entrydonepipeline id is chris Original Message From Smith Matt Sent Friday April AM To Hyde Chris Subject El Paso Manual Entry Chris I think we need a new pipeline for El Paso Manual Entry We need to enter linepack once a day Lets call the DRN LinePack and populate with flow type S Thanks Mat

Cycle For All Pipeliines Cc I have added a cycle to all pipelines in the databaseper our discussion this cycle will be used only in an emergency type situation we didnt scrape any data for whatever reason and there is some available that can be manually entered By being this also shouldnt affect the logic of Yans reports since he pulls the latest cycle available read the largest number if ANY scraped data gets in the DB it will be returned in place of any cycle data Any questions feel free to ask Chris

RE Northwest Foreign Key Problems Cc Donetheses should no longer throw foreign key violations when scraped Chris Original Message From Smith Matt Sent Tuesday April PM To Hyde Chris Cc Piazze Tara Subject Re Northwest Foreign Key Problems Chris The IHS DRNs are identified in red below Please make one up for the Novelty Hill MS point Thanks Mat PS This just reminded me that we need to start scraping that additional PGE point that we discussed last week From Chris nronXgate on AM To Matt NRON Tara NRON cc Colin nronXgate Subject Northwest Foreign Key Problems Hellosince I was working to reload some cycle data for Northwest today it seemed like a good a time as any to take care of these few foreign key violations as well These points are reported on the Northwest site but do not appear in our PIPELINELOCATION table as of yet hence the foreign key violation OWYHEE COMPRESSOR NORTH DOUGLAS RECEIPT NOVELTY HILL MS mkup one FOUNDATION CREEK PLANT If we can get these matched to their IHS DRN counterparts that would be great If not we can make up the IHS number as we have in the past Thanks Chris

Northwest Foreign Key Problems Cc Hellosince I was working to reload some cycle data for Northwest today it seemed like a good a time as any to take care of these few foreign key violations as well These points are reported on the Northwest site but do not appear in our PIPELINELOCATION table as of yet hence the foreign key violation OWYHEE COMPRESSOR NORTH DOUGLAS RECEIPT NOVELTY HILL MS FOUNDATION CREEK PLANT If we can get these matched to their IHS DRN counterparts that would be great If not we can make up the IHS number as we have in the past Thanks Chris

URL Changes Cc Please note that the URLs for the following web applications have changed Pipeline Manual Entry commoditywebsenagassecuresectionspipelinemanualentry Pipeline DB Editor commoditywebsenagassecuresectionspipelinedbeditor Key Violations commoditywebsenagassecuresectionspipelinekeyviolations This change was made to better secure these apps as well as to consolidate development efforts into one area If you have any questions or if you experience any problems using the above URLs just let me know Thanks Chris
